qas.question: What type of research was Princess Elizabeth station built to study?
How much did the Princess Elizabeth station cost?
What unique characteristic does the Princess Elizabeth station feature?
From what country was the Princess Elizabeth station shipped?
Who is the leader of the station design team?

plausible_answers.text: Belgian-based International Polar Foundation unveiled the Princess Elisabeth station

qas.question: Who unveiled the Princess Elisabeth on 7 September 2006?

plausible_answers.text: leader of the station design team and manager of the project

context: On 6 September 2007, <b5_0>Belgian-based <b7_0>International Polar Foundation<b7_0/> unveiled the <b6_0><b8_0>Princess Elisabeth<b6_0/> station<b8_0/><b5_0/>, the world's first <a2_0>zero-emissions<a2_0/> polar science station in Antarctica to research <a0_0>climate change<a0_0/>. Costing <a1_0>$16.3 million<a1_0/>, the prefabricated station, which is part of the International Polar Year, was shipped to the South Pole from <a3_0>Belgium<a3_0/> by the end of 2008 to monitor the health of the polar regions. Belgian polar explorer Alain Hubert stated: "This base will be the first of its kind to produce zero emissions, making it a unique model of how energy should be used in the Antarctic." <a4_0>Johan Berte<a4_0/> is the <b9_0>leader of the station design team and manager of the project<b9_0/> which conducts research in climatology, glaciology and microbiology.
